item.title: Notes on Karl Marx's Capital Volume One
item.description: [All page references refer to the unabridged Penguin Edition] Chapter One: Commodities The Two Factors of the Commodity 125 The capitalist economy consists of commodities. A commodity is an object of consumption or of production. It satisfies a need, this need is referred to as the commodity’s use-value. [126 Footnote cites Locke ‘The natural worth of anything consists in its fitness to supply the necessities, or serve the conveniences of human life’.
